sub_title: Data expert | Software developer | Researcher at heart
summary:
Playful, sharp, creative mind fond of mathematical modelling, A.I., software development, languages and music. 

Two things Alonso enjoys: i) addressing any problem that orbits around sustainability/circularity and ii) solving data puzzles/programming. The latter he mostly does in python or R but you will find him a versatile person who comfortably treks across uncharted territories.

Quintessentially T-shaped, his problem-solving style is that of a generalist and it often involves first coming up with the solution's high-level architecture, then, fine-tuning it down to the specifics of the original problem. He carries a solid weight of practical experience under his belt most of which he has gained working on projects in a wide variety of environments: from academia, over the IT- and the financial sector to government.

When not in front of the screen, you will likely find him somewhere in Greece improving his Greek, drinking Raki and wracking his brains for meaningful steps he can take to leave a cleaner, greener, more sustainable world behind him.

projects.title: ZaldiBase (personal project)
projects.description: ZaldiBase is a Shiny App I have been developing together with a good friend of mine. It streamlines the workflow of a team of surgeons in a French hospital. It also contains a dashboard where data gets analysed real-time and displayed allowing members of the team to swiftly address relevant medical questions of their field of research.

contributors.headline: Data expert | Software developer | Researcher at heart
Neurosurgeon / Spine Surgeon

projects.title: Machine Learning Assisted Ground-price Advising (MALAGA-project)
projects.description: Designed a data science project for a Master's thesis. Under my supervision, David Chen built and trained an XG-boost model that predicts transaction prices of houses in Amsterdam, then built a Shiny dashboard in order to call his model from a user-friendly interface. He successfully graduated from the Data Science track at University of Amsterdam in the summer 2022.

projects.title: Implementation of an SFTR reporting solution
projects.description: Essentially, the solution consists of an ETL pipeline that helps streaming any underwriting, modification, valuation and trade termination of Derivatives or Securities Financing Transactions, directly towards a major Trade Repository system.

projects.title: Development of a toolkit to automate credit risk validation results
projects.description: A validation toolkit inspired by the need of credit institutions to automatically produce the ECB supplementary reporting regarding the validation of their IRB models. This toolkit helps banks to build their validation sample for each credit risk parameter (PD, LGD, LGD in-default, EL BE, CCF) and perform all necessary qualitative and statistical tests (as required by the ECB) in either SAS, python or R, then inject those results into the reporting template (issued by the ECB).

projects.title: Detection of potential fraudsters
projects.description: Development of a tool that parses a 4Mio+ entry black list and matches potential fraudsters to our client's clients, allowing thus our client to selectively analyse flagged profiles (on a custom UI) and determine whether they might be unknowingly engaging in fraud.

profile_positions.title: Senior Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Short selection of tasks:
- Process improvement and/or automation with R and Python
- Model validation in the realm of Credit Risk (CR). Development of a toolkit in R, python, SAS and VBA to automate CR reporting of validation results as required by the ECB.
- Software development: computation of (financial) product prices in R based on swap volatility curves.
- Project management: building Finalyse's SFTR reporting solution (python, SQL, C#)
- Training: I put together a five-level Python learning journey for current and future Finalysers to work their way to becoming Pythonistas step by step.

Skills:
- Software development (Python & R)
- DB management (T-SQL)
- Responding to RFPs
- (Agile) Project Management - SCRUM master
- Mentoring of junior consultants

profile_positions.title: Guest Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Main project: Expanding society’s toolbox to harvest solar energy: creating multiscale computational models to optimize oxygenic photosynthesis.
Tasks:
- Mathemathical modelling of data using Mathematica & Matlab
- Data analysis: development of an own method for data analysis based on Singular Value Decomposition, dimensionality reduction and optimisation of residuals
- Designing, planning and performing experiments: steady-state & time-resolved fluorescence
- Automation of data acquisition using LabView 
- Presenting results at national and international conferences
- Collaborating with other research groups
- Publishing in peer reviewed journals
- Teaching: 'Applied Informatics' & 'Modelling'
Problem-solving environments included: R, Mathematica, Excel & VBA

Skills:
- Analytical thinking
- Hitting deadlines
- Straight-to-the-point formulation of complex ideas
- When in the comfort zone, fast-paced, result-oriented worker
- When not in the comfort zone, quick-learner
- Strong communicative skills
- Project management 
- Excellent teamplayer
- Easy-to-work-with in a multicultural setting
- Still pleasant in highly stressful situations
